articles.title: Okta (OKTA): Revisiting Valuation After Recent Share Price Strength
articles.mainIdea: Okta (OKTA): Revisiting Valuation After Recent Share Price Strength
articles.summary: Simply Wall St.: Okta (OKTA): Revisiting Valuation After Recent Share Price Strength. Okta (OKTA) has been quietly grinding higher, with the stock up around 16% over the past month even as the past 3 months have been roughly flat. That move has investors revisiting its valuation. See our latest analysis for Okta. Zooming out, Okta’s roughly 15 percent year to date share price return signals that sentiment is slowly improving as investors reassess both its growth runway and security risk profile following earlier execution concerns. If Okta’s move has you rethinking where...

articles.title: Does New SaaS and Cybersecurity Expertise on Okta's Board (OKTA) Strengthen Its AI Security Narrative?
articles.mainIdea: Does New SaaS and Cybersecurity Expertise on Okta's Board (OKTA) Strengthen Its AI Security Narrative?
articles.summary: Simply Wall St.: Does New SaaS and Cybersecurity Expertise on Okta's Board (OKTA) Strengthen Its AI Security Narrative?. Okta recently expanded its board of directors from 10 to 11 members, appointing SaaS veteran Rob Bernshteyn and cybersecurity leader Paul Sagan, while director Mary Agnes (Maggie) Wilderotter resigned for personal reasons unrelated to the company. These board additions, combined with Okta’s role in securing AI-driven payments for partners like Equals Money, highlight the company’s focus on identity-led security for emerging AI and fintech use cases. We’ll now examine how the appointment of...

articles.title: My husband and I are splitting our estate between his child and my three children. Should they get equal shares?
articles.mainIdea: My husband and I are splitting our estate between his child and my three children. Should they get equal shares?
articles.summary: MarketWatch: My husband and I are splitting our estate between his child and my three children. Should they get equal shares?. “We try to help all our kids when we can, yet push for self-sufficiency.”
